wikipedia_page.main: David Richard Seaborne Davies (26 June 1904 – 26 October 1984) was a Welsh law teacher who served briefly as a Liberal Party Member of Parliament (MP).

response: *David Richard Seaborne Davies (1904–1984), Welsh legal academic, briefly a British Liberal Party Member of Parliament in 1945
|26 April 1945Seaborne Davies retained Caernarvon Boroughs for the Liberals in the by-election but lost the seat to the Conservatives in the 1945 general election.
*26 October – Seaborne Davies, lawyer and politician, 80
*Seaborne Davies, Liberal 1945 Caernarvon Boroughs by-election 91 days 2
*1967: Professor David Richard Seaborne Davies of Y Garn, Pwllheli.
*26 June - Prof Seaborne Davies, law teacher and three times President of the National Eisteddfod (died 1984)

He was elected at the general election in July 1945 as the MP for Caernarvon Boroughs. His victory by a narrow margin of 336 votes ousted the Liberal MP Seaborne Davies, who had won the seat at a by-election in April that year, after long-serving David Lloyd George had been elevated to the peerage.

1. The Liberal Party candidate, supporting the coalition government, was 40-year old Seaborne Davies (1904–1984). After winning the by-election, he served in Parliament between April and July 1945 only, as he was defeated by a Conservative candidate in the 1945 United Kingdom general election.
